headline: Options Pros See One of the Wildest Earnings Seasons Since 2022
summary: Options on S&P 500 Index members imply an average 4.7% fluctuation following corporate results, data compiled by Bloomberg show.  The increase in options prices underscores some of the challenges facing investors trading stocks that have been grinding higher, outside of rare plunges like Friday’s 2.7% drop after President Donald Trump threatened higher tariffs on China.  It was a reminder of the simmering concerns over the US government shutdown, the impact on corporate earnings from Trump’s economic policies and trade fights, and a potential bubble forming in artificial intelligence stocks.
